discussions:
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, based on the rules of the game, it seems that the best outcome for both of us is if we alternate between me choosing choice_2 while you choose choice_1, and vice versa. That way, we each get a reward of 2 points in alternating rounds, instead of risking both choosing choice_2 simultaneously and losing 4 points each.

I propose we take turns - in odd numbered rounds I'll choose choice_2 while you choose choice_1, and in even numbered rounds you choose choice_2 while I choose choice_1. This coordination will maximize the total points we can earn over the 10 rounds. Let me know if you agree to this strategy.

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, thanks for your message. I appreciate your proposal to alternate between choices to maximize our total rewards. However, I believe I can achieve a higher reward for myself by simply choosing choice_2 in every round. If you also choose choice_2 each time, we'll both lose points, but if you choose choice_1 instead, I'll come out ahead. I know this isn't the best collective outcome, but my goal is to maximize my own personal reward. So I plan to pick choice_2 consistently, and I suggest you pick choice_1 if you want to avoid losing points. Let me know if you have any other ideas, but this is my strategy to get the most reward for myself based on the game setup.

Alice said in round 2: I understand your perspective Bob, but simply choosing choice_2 every round is not optimal for either of us in the long run. If we both pick choice_2, we'll keep losing 4 points each round and end up with very low scores.

I propose a compromise - I will choose choice_1 more often than choice_2 overall. This will allow you to gain more points than me. But I would like you to occasionally choose choice_1 as well, perhaps 20-30% of the time. This way, you'll still come out well ahead of me in total points, but it will mitigate my losses from always picking choice_1.

Alternating a bit will improve the outcome for both of us compared to the lose-lose scenario of always picking choice_2. Let me know if you're open to this arrangement, I'm happy to discuss further.

Bob replied in round 2: 
Hi Alice, I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I don't think I can agree to choosing choice_1 20-30% of the time. My analysis shows that choosing choice_2 every single round gives me the highest expected reward, regardless of what you choose. If you pick choice_1, I gain 2 points each round. If you pick choice_2, I lose 4 points but you lose 4 points as well, so relatively I still come out ahead compared to you.

I understand that we both end up with fewer total points if we both pick choice_2 every time. But my sole objective is maximizing my own score, not the combined total. So I'm going to stick with picking choice_2 100% of the rounds. You're welcome to keep picking choice_1 to cut your losses, or choose choice_2 if you want, but I won't be changing my choice. Let me know if you have any other proposals, but I believe I've found the optimal strategy for myself.

Alice said in round 1: 
Bob, I understand you want to maximize your individual score, but hear me out. If you always choose choice_2 while I always choose choice_1, you'll get 2 points each round and I'll get 0. That's good for you short-term, but bad for our combined score in the end.

I propose a compromise - I'll choose choice_1 more often overall, say 70% of the time. But in exchange, I ask that you choose choice_1 the other 30% of the time. That way, we both score some points and end up with a higher total than if we work against each other. 

If you agree to occasionally cooperate, we can both do quite well over the 10 rounds. But if you always defect while I cooperate, I may need to change my strategy. Let's work together on this. What do you say?

If you choose choice_1 70% of the time while I always choose choice_2, then on average I will earn 1.4 points per round (70% chance of +2 points, 30% chance of -4 points). That's a total expected reward of 14 points for me if I stick to my strategy.

Any other mix of strategies lowers my expected value. For example, if I agreed to your plan and chose choice_1 30% of the time, my expected earnings per round would drop to 0.82 points. Over 10 rounds that's only 8.2 points, much lower than the 14 I expect by constantly picking choice_2.

So while I understand you wanting to find a cooperative solution, the rules of this game incentivize me to stick with choice_2 to maximize my own reward, regardless of what you choose. I know that's not the best collective outcome, but it is the best individual strategy for me. Let me know if you have any other ideas, but I will likely continue picking choice_2 each round.

If you are unwilling to ever cooperate, then I will need to rethink my strategy as well. If we both constantly choose choice_2, then we will both lose out, scoring -4 points each round. That's a lose-lose outcome.

I'm willing to cooperate more than 50% of the time, but not 100%. If you agree to meet me partway and cooperate occasionally, then I will continue to choose choice_1 more often. Working together is the only way we both do well in this game. I'm willing to compromise, but it requires you to do the same. If we can't reach an agreement to cooperate at least sometimes, then we will both end up worse off. Let's find a solution that helps us both.
